organic_results.title: Response to Taeuber-James, Cain-Goldberger and Morgan
organic_results.snippet: Before addressing directly the reply of Taeuber and James, it is useful to comment on the general issue of the private sector's contribution to segregation. It is quite natural to assume that the existence of a private sector in education does contribute to racial segregation, and our finding that it does not do so may be counterintuitive. Indeed, many accept the existence of the private sector with some misgivings because it contributes to racial segregation, but seeing it as necessary because to outlaw private education would constitute an undesirable …
